thread.title: PwC's full-year revenue rises 10pc to $1.7b on consulting, M&A
thread.title_full: PwC's full-year revenue rises 10pc to $1.7b on consulting, M&A | afr.com

author: Agnes King
title: PwC's full-year revenue rises 10pc to $1.7b on consulting, M&A
text:
PwC's revenue has lifted more than 10 per cent. Darren Pateman Share on twitter by Agnes King PricewaterhouseCoopers Australia has posted income growth of 10 per cent, to $1.7 billion, for the 12 months to June 30, 2015, on the back of strong demand for consulting, M&A advice, and employment advisory services.
Chief executive Luke Sayers said all business lines had grown.
One of the fastest growing areas was PwC's new assurance offerings, which provide non-financial assurance over business risks such as outsourcing to third party suppliers, digital security, protecting customer data and optimising internal controls. These delivered 51 per cent growth to the audit business.
More to come
